intro: Hippia montana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink, red, or white. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Hippia montana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical environments.
